title: The Shepherd

thumbnail.alt_text: A shepherd, dressed in yellow, drinks from a stream while sheep graze.

publication_history:
W. Michel, “Maler Eugène Zak – Paris,” Deutsche Kunst und Dekoration, vol. 30, Aug.-Sep. 1912, pp. 369-376 (ill.).

International Exhibition of Modern Art, exh. cat. (New York: Association of American Painters and Sculptors, Inc., 1913), cat. 233, as Le Berger.

International Exhibition of Modern Art, 2nd ed., exh. cat. (New York: Association of American Painters and Sculptors, Inc., 1913), cat. 452.

Arthur Jerome Eddy, Cubists and Post-Impressionists (Chicago: A. C. McClurg, 1914), p. 200-201 (color plate opposite p. 8).

The Art Institute of Chicago, Exhibition of Paintings from the Collection of the Late Arthur Jerome Eddy, exh. cat. (Chicago: The Art Institute of Chicago, 1922), cat. 67 (ill.).

H. Martinie, “Eugène Zak” Cicerone, vol. 17, no. 13, July 1925, p. 649.

The Art Institute of Chicago, Exhibition of the Arthur Jerome Eddy Collection of Modern Paintings and Sculpture, exh. cat. (Chicago: The Art Institute of Chicago, 1931), cat. 20.

C. J. Bulliet, “The Eddy Gift to Chicago,” Creative Art, Vol. 10, March 1932, p. 216.

The Art Institute of Chicago, A Guide to the Paintings in the Permanent Collection (Chicago: The Art Institute of Chicago, 1932), pp. 77, 177 (ill.).

An Exhibition of Literature and Poetry in Painting since 1850, (Hartford: Wadsworth Atheneum, 1933), cat. 76 (ill.).

Art Institute of Chicago, A Century of Progress: Exhibition of Paintings and Sculpture, (Chicago:  Lakeside Press, R. R. Donnelley & Sons Company, 1933), p. 81, cat. 743.

Art Institute of Chicago, A Century of Progress: Exhibition of Paintings and Sculpture, (Chicago:  Lakeside Press, R. R. Donnelley & Sons Company, 1934), p. 53, cat. 366B.

Art Institute of Chicago, Paintings in the Art Institute of Chicago: A Catalogue of the Picture Collection, (Chicago: Art Institute, 1961), p. 486.
 
Munson-Williams-Proctor Institute, 1913 Armory Show—50th Anniversary Exhibition 1963, exh. cat. (New York: Munson-Williams-Proctor Institute, 1963), p. 208, no. 223.

Milton W. Brown, The Story of the Armory Show (Greenwich, Conn.: New York Graphic Society, 1963), pp. 100, 301, no. 233, as Le Berger.

Artur Tanikowski, Eugeniusz Zak (Sejny, Poland: Pogranicze, 2003), pp. 11, 53, 115, (ill.).
exhibition_history:
New York, International Exhibition of Modern Art, February 17–March 15, 1913, cat. 233, as Le Berger; traveled to The Art Institute of Chicago, March 24–April 16, 1913 (cat. 452).

The Art Institute of Chicago, Exhibition of Paintings from the Collection of the Late Arthur Jerome Eddy, September 19–October 22, 1922, cat. 67 (ill.).

The Art Institute of Chicago, Exhibition of the Arthur Jerome Eddy Collection of Modern Paintings and Sculpture, December 22, 1931-January17, 1932, cat. 20 (ill.).

Hartford, Wadsworth Athenaeum, An Exhibition of Literature and Poetry in Painting since 1850, January-February 1933, cat. 76 (ill.).

Art Institute of Chicago, A Century of Progress: Exhibition of Paintings and Sculpture, June 1-November 1, 1933, p. 81, cat. 743.

Art Institute of Chicago, A Century of Progress: Exhibition of Paintings and Sculpture, June 1-November 1, 1934, p. 53, cat. 366B.

Utica, Munson-Williams-Proctor Institute, 1913 Armory Show—50th Anniversary Exhibition 1963, February 17–March 31, 1963, p. 208, no. 223; traveled to New York, Armory of the Sixty-ninth Regiment, April 6–28, 1963.

Warsaw, National Museum of Warsaw, Eugeniusz Zak (1884-1926), December 18, 2003-February 28, 2004, p. 115 (ill.).
provenance_text: Arthur Jerome Eddy (1859-1920), Chicago, 1913 [purchased at the International Exhibition of Modern Art (The Armory Show), New York, February 27, 1913; Milton Brown, The Story of the Armory Show, 1963, p. 301]; by descent to his wife Lucy O. Eddy (1863-1931) and son Jerome O. Eddy (1891-1951), Chicago, 1920; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1931.
